intro: Rohria squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa rohria, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, square-shaped stems and showy, pink to red bracts that resemble flowers. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions. Rohria squarrosa is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
